original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub las rgyab kyis phyogs pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub chen po'i mchog sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub las rgyab kyis phyogs pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub chen po'i mchog sbyin pa'o //
translated: For those who turn their backs on the enlightenment of the Buddha, he bestows the supreme gift of the great enlightenment of the Buddha.

original: 'khor ba las ma bsgral ba rnams sgrol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba las ma bsgral ba rnams sgrol bar byed pa'o //
translated: For those who are not liberated from saṃsāra, he brings liberation.

original: @319b mun pas long bar byed cing bsgribs pa rnams la myos pa'i mun pa sel ba sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: @319b mun pas long bar byed cing bsgribs pa rnams la myos pa'i mun pa sel ba sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: For those who are blinded and obscured by darkness, he bestows the gift of dispelling the darkness of intoxication.

original: sgrib par bya ba rnams kyi sgrib pa dang bral bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib par bya ba rnams kyi sgrib pa dang bral bar byed pa'o //
translated: For those who are obscured, he removes the obscurations.

original: mtshams med pa lnga'i 'gro ba rnams kyis mtshams med pa lnga sbyong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga'i 'gro ba rnams kyis mtshams med pa lnga sbyong bar byed pa'o //
translated: For those who are in the five destinies, he purifies the five deadly actions.

original: ngag nyams pa rnams kyi ngag rnam par dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngag nyams pa rnams kyi ngag rnam par dag par byed pa'o //
translated: It purifies the speech of those whose speech is impaired.

original: ma grub pa rnams la mchog gi dngos grub sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa rnams la mchog gi dngos grub sbyin pa'o //
translated: It bestows the supreme attainment upon those who have not attained it.

original: thun tshags dang bcas pa rnams kyi thun tshags dang bral zhing yongs su dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thun tshags dang bcas pa rnams kyi thun tshags dang bral zhing yongs su dag par byed pa'o //
translated: It removes and purifies the obstacles of those who have obstacles.

original: dan pa rnams la mchog sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dan pa rnams la mchog sbyin pa'o //
translated: It bestows the supreme upon those who are not supreme.

original: mya ngan las ma 'das rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchog go /
analyzed: mya ngan las ma 'das rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchog go /
translated: It is the supreme nirvāṇa of those who have not attained nirvāṇa.

original: brda mi phrad pa rnams la brda sprod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brda mi phrad pa rnams la brda sprod par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme teaching for those who do not understand the language.

original: kun nas 'khrugs pa rnams kyi sems gnas pa'i mchog go /
analyzed: kun nas 'khrugs pa rnams kyi sems gnas pa'i mchog go /
translated: It is the supreme abiding of the mind for those who are agitated.

original: mchog med pa rnams la mchog sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: mchog med pa rnams la mchog sbyin pa'o //
translated: It bestows the supreme upon those who are not supreme.

original: rmi lam ngan pa mthong ba rnams la rmi lam chen po'i mchog ston pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam ngan pa mthong ba rnams la rmi lam chen po'i mchog ston pa'o //
translated: It shows the supreme great dream for those who have bad dreams.

original: bkres pa rnams la kha zas kyi mchog sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bkres pa rnams la kha zas kyi mchog sbyin pa'o //
translated: It bestows the supreme food for those who are hungry.

original: skom pa rnams btung ba chen po'i ro la yongs su longs spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skom pa rnams btung ba chen po'i ro la yongs su longs spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: It causes those who are thirsty to enjoy the taste of the great drink.

original: gcer bu rnams kyi gos dang bsgo ba so sor thob cing grub pa'o //
analyzed: gcer bu rnams kyi gos dang bsgo ba so sor thob cing grub pa'o //
translated: It is the clothing of the naked, the command of those who have not attained.

original: mdze can rnams kyi mdze dang bral bar byed pa'o //🔽sha bkra can rnams kyi sha bkra yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mdze can rnams kyi mdze dang bral bar byed pa'o // sha bkra can rnams kyi sha bkra yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the cure for the sick.🔽It is the purification of those with leprosy.

original: rims kyis btab ba rnams kyi rims dang bral bar byed pa'o //🔽gdon gyis zin pa rnams kyi gdon dang / gshed byed @320a *//
analyzed: rims kyis btab ba rnams kyi rims dang bral bar byed pa'o // gdon gyis zin pa rnams kyi gdon dang / gshed byed @320a *//
translated: It is the cure for those with fevers.

original: pa dang / gdul dka' ba rnams 'dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang / gdul dka' ba rnams 'dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the protection of those possessed by spirits, of those who are bewitched, of those who are bedeviled.🔽It is the taming of the untamed.

original: dgra bo phyin ci log pa rnams kyi dgra rnams dang bral bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bo phyin ci log pa rnams kyi dgra rnams dang bral bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the protection of those who are enemies, of those who are hostile.

original: dbul po rnams la nor sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbul po rnams la nor sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the giving of wealth to the poor.

original: bu bza' can rnams kyi bu bza' cher 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu bza' can rnams kyi bu bza' cher 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the increase of the food of those who have little food.

original: mun pas long par byas par thams cad kyi sgron ma'i shing dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer stong gis kun tu snang ba'o //
analyzed: mun pas long par byas par thams cad kyi sgron ma'i shing dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer stong gis kun tu snang ba'o //
translated: It is the lamp for all who are in the darkness, the light of the sun and moon.

original: rgyal pos bcom pa rnams la longs spyod rgya chen po cher sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal pos bcom pa rnams la longs spyod rgya chen po cher sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is the great giving of wealth to those who are robbed by kings.

original: 'khon pa rnams gcig tu byed pa'o //🔽ser sna can rnams kyi ser sna shin tu 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: 'khon pa rnams gcig tu byed pa'o // ser sna can rnams kyi ser sna shin tu 'joms pa'o //
translated: It brings together those who are in conflict.🔽It overcomes the stinginess of the stingy.

original: 'dod chags la chags pa rnams kyi 'dod chags rab tu 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la chags pa rnams kyi 'dod chags rab tu 'joms pa'o //
translated: It overcomes the desire of those who are attached to desire.

original: rmongs pa chung ba ma yin pa rnams kyi rmongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa chung ba ma yin pa rnams kyi rmongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It removes the confusion of those who are not confused.

original: mi dge ba'i lam gyis rab tu nyams pa rnams kyis dge ba'i lam gyi yid chos kyi nang du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i lam gyis rab tu nyams pa rnams kyis dge ba'i lam gyi yid chos kyi nang du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: It brings those who are lost on the path of nonvirtue to the path of virtue.

original: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'jigs pa med par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'jigs pa med par 'gyur zhing /
translated: It brings fearlessness to those who are under the power of others.

original: yid chos kyi nang du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid chos kyi nang du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: It brings the mind to the Dharma.

original: log par ltung ba rnams kyis shes rab dang / blo dang / shes bzhin dang / bkram pa rnams kyi blo bsnyen par 'gyur /
analyzed: log par ltung ba rnams kyis shes rab dang / blo dang / shes bzhin dang / bkram pa rnams kyi blo bsnyen par 'gyur /
translated: It brings the wisdom, intelligence, alertness, and eloquence of those who have fallen into error.

original: sangs rgyas ma mthong ba rnams de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong bar 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ma mthong ba rnams de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong bar 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It brings the desire to see the Tathāgata to those who have not seen the Buddha.

original: chos thos pa dang bral ba rnams kyi chos chen po'i ro rgya chen po thos par @320b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thos pa dang bral ba rnams kyi chos chen po'i ro rgya chen po thos par @320b 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are deprived of hearing the Dharma will hear the great Dharma.

original: dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang bral ba rnams kyis lha dang nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang bral ba rnams kyis lha dang nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are deprived of serving the Saṅgha will serve the Saṅgha of gods and hearers.

original: dbang po nyams pa rnams kyi dbang po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa rnams kyi dbang po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are deficient in faculties will have their faculties perfected.

original: yan lag rnam par nyams pa'i sems can rnams kyi so so'i yan lag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag rnam par nyams pa'i sems can rnams kyi so so'i yan lag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those sentient beings who are deficient in limbs will have their limbs perfected.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba dang bral ba rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen po mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba dang bral ba rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen po mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those bodhisattvas who are deprived of seeing will see the great assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: lhas yongs su spangs pa rnams kyi lha'i tshogs thams cad kyis yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhas yongs su spangs pa rnams kyi lha'i tshogs thams cad kyis yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are abandoned by the gods will be upheld by the entire assembly of gods.

original: nyon mongs pa dang sgrib pas dkris pa'i sems rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang sgrib pas dkris pa'i sems rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The minds that are bound by afflictions and obscurations will be completely liberated from all afflictions and obscurations.

original: phyag na rdo rje /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

original: don yod pa'i mchod pa'i nor bu'i snying po'i gzungs spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: don yod pa'i mchod pa'i nor bu'i snying po'i gzungs spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis gsungs pa ni /
translated: the dhāraṇī of the inexhaustible offering jewel taught by Avalokiteśvara

original: de ltar rdzu 'phrul che ste /
analyzed: de ltar rdzu 'phrul che ste /
translated: is like this, with great miraculous power.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa'i sprin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa'i sprin /
translated: It is a cloud of offerings to all tathāgatas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mchod pa'i sprin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mchod pa'i sprin /
translated: a cloud of offerings to all bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod pa'i sprin gyi char 'bebs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod pa'i sprin gyi char 'bebs pa /
translated: a rain of clouds of offerings of the seven precious substances in all buddha-fields,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par dus gsum du gshegs shing bzhugs pa rnams kyi dpag bsam gyi shing chen po'i mchod pa'i sprin gyi char 'bebs par byed pa'i @321a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par dus gsum du gshegs shing bzhugs pa rnams kyi dpag bsam gyi shing chen po'i mchod pa'i sprin gyi char 'bebs par byed pa'i @321a *//
translated: a rain of clouds of offerings of great wish-fulfilling trees of all tathāgatas in all buddha-fields, equal to those of all tathāgatas in the three times.

original: mchod sprin 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchod sprin 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will arise as an offering cloud.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dam tshig rig sngags kyi dkyil 'khor gyi kho na nyid sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi dam tshig rig sngags kyi dkyil 'khor gyi kho na nyid sgrub par byed pa /
translated: This is the accomplishment of the reality of the maṇḍala of vidyā-mantras of the pledge of the family of all tathāgatas,

original: rmad du byung ba'i dngos grub yang dag par ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i dngos grub yang dag par ston par byed pa'o //
translated: which reveals the marvelous powers.

original: rig sngags kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad dang / rig pa'i rgyal po'i lha rnams dang / gsang sngags kyi lha thams cad spyan 'dren zhing 'gugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad dang / rig pa'i rgyal po'i lha rnams dang / gsang sngags kyi lha thams cad spyan 'dren zhing 'gugs par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the invocation and summoning of all the deities of the maṇḍala of vidyā-mantras, the deities of the king of vidyās, and all the deities of secret mantras.

original: 'di ni / pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of the six perfections.

original: 'di ni / thams cad du gsang ba'i sgo ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / thams cad du gsang ba'i sgo ston par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the revelation of the door of all secrets.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: O Vajrapāṇi!

original: don yod pa'i mchod pa'i snying po'i gzungs 'di ni /
analyzed: don yod pa'i mchod pa'i snying po'i gzungs 'di ni /
translated: This dhāraṇī of the essence of Amoghaprīṣa

original: dus ma yin pa'i char dang / mu ge dang / dus kyi chu rnam par nyams pa la so sor bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i char dang / mu ge dang / dus kyi chu rnam par nyams pa la so sor bskyed pa'o //
translated: generates timely rain, timely water, and timely harvests in a timely manner.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gtsang mas khrus byas gos gtsang ba bsgos te yid rtse gcig tu byas na /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gtsang mas khrus byas gos gtsang ba bsgos te yid rtse gcig tu byas na /
translated: Then, the pure vidyādhara should bathe, put on clean clothes, and with a one-pointed mind🔽cultivate a mind of supreme love and compassion for all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la mchog tu brtse ba dang / byams pa'i sems bsgom par bya'o; ;mchod rten gyi yan lag dang nye ba'am /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mchog tu brtse ba dang / byams pa'i sems bsgom par bya'o; ;mchod rten gyi yan lag dang nye ba'am /
translated: In a place near a limb of a stūpa,

original: khang stong ngam /
analyzed: khang stong ngam /
translated: in an empty house,

original: ri bo'am / nags thibs po dang / dgon pa dang / skyed mos tshal lam /
analyzed: ri bo'am / nags thibs po dang / dgon pa dang / skyed mos tshal lam /
translated: on a mountain, in a dense forest, in a solitary place, in a garden,

original: dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba'am /
translated: in a monastery,

original: chu klung ngam /🔽mtshe'u 'am / rdzing bu'am /
analyzed: chu klung ngam / mtshe'u 'am / rdzing bu'am /
translated: near a river,🔽a lake, a pond,

original: klu gnas pa'i mtsho'am /🔽lha'i gnas sam /
analyzed: klu gnas pa'i mtsho'am / lha'i gnas sam /
translated: a lake inhabited by nāgas,🔽in a divine abode,

original: rgyal po'i pho brang yang rung ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang yang rung ste /
translated: or in a royal palace,

original: der rig sngags 'chang gtsang mar gnas pas sa @321b gzhi yongs su brtags pa cha mnyam pa mdzes par khru gnyis kyi tshad kyi dkyil 'khor byas las dang ba byung du ldan pas gru bzhi par cha gzhal ste legs par byi dor byas la shin tu 'jam par
analyzed: der rig sngags 'chang gtsang mar gnas pas sa @321b gzhi yongs su brtags pa cha mnyam pa mdzes par khru gnyis kyi tshad kyi dkyil 'khor byas las dang ba byung du ldan pas gru bzhi par cha gzhal ste legs par byi dor byas la shin tu 'jam par
translated: the pure vidyādhara should examine the ground. In a place that is even, beautiful, and two cubits in size, he should measure out a square maṇḍala with four corners. With a pure mind, he should make it smooth and very soft.

original: bya'o // de'i steng du tsandan dang / dri'i chus byug par bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // de'i steng du tsandan dang / dri'i chus byug par bya'o //
translated: One should anoint it with sandalwood and perfumed water.

original: gur gum gyis rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / phyag rgya rnams ri mor 'bri'o //
analyzed: gur gum gyis rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / phyag rgya rnams ri mor 'bri'o //
translated: One should draw various signs and seals with saffron.

original: de la dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi snying po klu mgo bo dgu pa skyil mo krung gis 'dug pa bri'o //
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi snying po klu mgo bo dgu pa skyil mo krung gis 'dug pa bri'o //
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala, one should draw the essence of the nine-headed nāga, seated in the cross-legged posture.

original: gra bzhi'i nang du chud par don yod zhags pa bri'o //
analyzed: gra bzhi'i nang du chud par don yod zhags pa bri'o //
translated: Inside the four corners, one should draw Amoghapāśa.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi khor yug tu ji ltar thob pa'i phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags rnams bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi khor yug tu ji ltar thob pa'i phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags rnams bri bar bya'o //
translated: Outside the maṇḍala, one should draw the seals and mantras as one has obtained them.

original: bsgo bzhi rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: bsgo bzhi rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
translated: One should open the four doors

original: ji ltar 'byor ba'i gtor ma sna tshogs pa'i ro'i gtor ma dkar po dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / dri dang / mar me dang / gang ba'i bum pa dang / gtor ma dang / bdug pa'i pog phor gyis nye bar mdzes par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byor ba'i gtor ma sna tshogs pa'i ro'i gtor ma dkar po dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / dri dang / mar me dang / gang ba'i bum pa dang / gtor ma dang / bdug pa'i pog phor gyis nye bar mdzes par bya'o //
translated: and beautify it with various bali offerings as one can afford, with white food offerings, flowers, incense, perfume, lamps, vases filled with water, bali offerings, and incense burners.

original: rig sngags 'chang gis ches mngon du don yod zhags pa lan bdun bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gis ches mngon du don yod zhags pa lan bdun bzlas par bya'o //
translated: The vidyādhara should recite the Amoghapāśa mantra seven times.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po la lan gcig bzlas pas mngon par dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po la lan gcig bzlas pas mngon par dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: He should consecrate himself by reciting the Krodharāja mantra once.

original: don yod pa'i lcags skyu dang / khro bo lcags kyu dus gcig tu brjod do //
analyzed: don yod pa'i lcags skyu dang / khro bo lcags kyu dus gcig tu brjod do //
translated: He should recite the Amoghavajra and Krodhāṅkuśa mantras simultaneously.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal po lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal po lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should recite the king of mantras three times.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs te @322a *//
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs te @322a *//
translated: Then the vidyādhara, facing the maṇḍala,

original: bzlas pa'i cho ga bya'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i cho ga bya'o //
translated: should perform the rite of recitation.

original: don yod pa'i mchod pa nor bu'i snying po lan stong rtsa brgyad du bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: don yod pa'i mchod pa nor bu'i snying po lan stong rtsa brgyad du bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: He should recite the Amoghapūjāmaṇi-hṛdaya one thousand and eight times.

original: n'a ga ge sar dang / n'a la di na dang / rgya spos dang / gur gum dang / tsandan dang / yungs kar dang / li kha ra mnyam par sbyar ba'i gdug pal bzlas brjod brgya rtsa brgyad bya ste /
analyzed: n'a ga ge sar dang / n'a la di na dang / rgya spos dang / gur gum dang / tsandan dang / yungs kar dang / li kha ra mnyam par sbyar ba'i gdug pal bzlas brjod brgya rtsa brgyad bya ste /
translated: He should recite the mantra one hundred and eight times over a mixture of nāgapuṣpa, nalina, devagandha, saffron, sandalwood, white mustard seeds, and vermillion.

original: klu'i dkyil 'khor du bdug pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: klu'i dkyil 'khor du bdug pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: He should offer this as incense in the nāga maṇḍala.

original: klu'i lte ba'i steng du bdug spos kyi pog phor gang ba gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: klu'i lte ba'i steng du bdug spos kyi pog phor gang ba gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place a full incense burner on the nāga’s navel.

original: lan stong rtsa brgyad du bzlas pa'i mod nyid la klu'i zhags pa chen po las char gyi rgyun chen po 'byin te /
analyzed: lan stong rtsa brgyad du bzlas pa'i mod nyid la klu'i zhags pa chen po las char gyi rgyun chen po 'byin te /
translated: The moment one recites [the mantra] one thousand and eight times, a great rain will fall from the great nāga noose.

original: ji srid 'dod pa'i bar du char 'bebs so //
analyzed: ji srid 'dod pa'i bar du char 'bebs so //
translated: It will rain as much as one desires.

original: klu'i rgyal po'i ming nas bzung ste bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po'i ming nas bzung ste bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite [the mantra] while calling out the name of the nāga king.

original: klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho dang / dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo dang / nor rgyas kyi bu dang / 'jog po dang / hu lu dang / au lam bu la dang / chu lha dang / yid ldan dang / ae la'i 'dab ma dang /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho dang / dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo dang / nor rgyas kyi bu dang / 'jog po dang / hu lu dang / au lam bu la dang / chu lha dang / yid ldan dang / ae la'i 'dab ma dang /
translated: The nāga kings are Sāgara, Nanda, Upananda, Vāsuki, Takṣaka, Kulika, Utpala, Varuṇa, Manas, Aśvatara,

original: klu'i rgyal po kun nas 'khor ba'i gdugs te /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po kun nas 'khor ba'i gdugs te /
translated: and the nāga king Samantāvabhāsa.

original: klu'i rgyal po rnams las gcig smos par bya ste /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po rnams las gcig smos par bya ste /
translated: One should mention one of the nāga kings.

original: klu'i rgyal po de rnams kyi bden par dam bcas pas rnam par bzhag pa'i mod nyid la char gyi rgyan 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po de rnams kyi bden par dam bcas pas rnam par bzhag pa'i mod nyid la char gyi rgyan 'byin par byed de /
translated: By the truth of the nāga kings, the moment one makes an oath, a rain cloud will appear.

original: ji srid 'dod kyi bar du kun nas sbyor bas char stong phrag 'bebs so //
analyzed: ji srid 'dod kyi bar du kun nas sbyor bas char stong phrag 'bebs so //
translated: He will cause rain to fall for as many days as one desires.

original: yang na yungs kar la stong rtsa brgyad du bzlas pas klu'i rgyal po'i @322b snying ga'i steng du sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: yang na yungs kar la stong rtsa brgyad du bzlas pas klu'i rgyal po'i @322b snying ga'i steng du sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, one should incant mustard seeds one thousand and eight times and offer them into the fire above the heart of the king of nāgas.

original: sbyin sreg byas pa tsam gyi mod la 'phral nyid du stong phrag du mar aa bi r'a yam char gyi rgyan 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin sreg byas pa tsam gyi mod la 'phral nyid du stong phrag du mar aa bi r'a yam char gyi rgyan 'byin par byed do //
translated: As soon as the homa is performed, he will immediately cause a rain of many thousands of abhirājas to fall.

original: spar mo gang gis nyin mtshan gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad par char 'bebs so //
analyzed: spar mo gang gis nyin mtshan gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad par char 'bebs so //
translated: With one handful, he will cause rain to fall for one day and night.

original: spar mo gsum gyis nyin mtshan gsum du 'bebs so //
analyzed: spar mo gsum gyis nyin mtshan gsum du 'bebs so //
translated: With three handfuls, he will cause rain to fall for three days and nights.

original: sbar mo bdun gyis nyin mtshan bdun du char gyi rgyun chen po klu'i rgyal pos 'byin bar byed do //
analyzed: sbar mo bdun gyis nyin mtshan bdun du char gyi rgyun chen po klu'i rgyal pos 'byin bar byed do //
translated: With seven handfuls, the king of nāgas will cause a great downpour to fall for seven days and nights.

original: yang dag pa kho nar char gyi rgyun ltung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag pa kho nar char gyi rgyun ltung ngo //
translated: The rain will fall in the right way.

original: yang na klu'i ras ris bya ste /
analyzed: yang na klu'i ras ris bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, one should paint a nāga.

original: khru gang gi tshad la kun nas gru bzhi pa'i tshad kyi ras la ri mor bya'o //
analyzed: khru gang gi tshad la kun nas gru bzhi pa'i tshad kyi ras la ri mor bya'o //
translated: One should paint it on a cloth one cubit in size, square,

original: de'i dbus su rig pa'i rgyal bo 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus su rig pa'i rgyal bo 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bri bar bya ste /
translated: In the middle of it, one should draw the king of knowledge, Ārya Avalokiteśvara.

original: skyil mo krung gis 'dug pa /
analyzed: skyil mo krung gis 'dug pa /
translated: He should be drawn seated in the cross-legged posture,

original: phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa /
translated: with four arms,

original: ral gri dang / rtse gsum dang / zhags pa dang / padma thogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ral gri dang / rtse gsum dang / zhags pa dang / padma thogs par bya'o //
translated: holding a sword, a trident, a noose, and a lotus.

original: zhal khro gnyer can rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan ba /
analyzed: zhal khro gnyer can rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan ba /
translated: He should have a wrathful face, be adorned with all the ornaments,

original: ral ba'i cod pan gyis spud pa /🔽'od dpag med kyi cod pan can ral ba zla ba phyed pas nye bar mdzes pa /
analyzed: ral ba'i cod pan gyis spud pa / 'od dpag med kyi cod pan can ral ba zla ba phyed pas nye bar mdzes pa /
translated: and have a crown of hair.🔽He should have the crown of Amitābha, be beautified by a half-moon,

original: 'od 'dom gang bas yang dag par brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang bas yang dag par brgyan pa /
translated: and be adorned with a halo of light one fathom wide.

original: chu dang bcas pa'i padma'i gdan bya'o //🔽klu'i rgyal po de dag bus mo g-yas dang g-yon pa btsugs pa bya'o //
analyzed: chu dang bcas pa'i padma'i gdan bya'o // klu'i rgyal po de dag bus mo g-yas dang g-yon pa btsugs pa bya'o //
translated: He should be drawn on a lotus seat with water.🔽Those nāga kings should be drawn with their right and left knees bent.

original: klu'i gdengs ka dang bcas pa thal mo 'chang bas skyabs su 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: klu'i gdengs ka dang bcas pa thal mo 'chang bas skyabs su 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: They should have nāga hoods and be making the gesture of going for refuge with their palms joined.

original: de nas rig sngags des ras ris de la mngon du phyogs de smra ba bcad nas don yod pa'i mchod pa'i nor bu'i snying po'i gzungs stong rtsa @323a *//🔽brgyad du bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags des ras ris de la mngon du phyogs de smra ba bcad nas don yod pa'i mchod pa'i nor bu'i snying po'i gzungs stong rtsa @323a *// brgyad du bzlas par bya ste /
translated: Then, facing the painting with that knowledge-mantra, one should recite the dhāraṇī of the essence of the jewel of Amogha’s offering one thousand and eight times.

original: yungs kar la lan stong rtsa brgyad bzlas nas klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho la bsnun par bya'o //
analyzed: yungs kar la lan stong rtsa brgyad bzlas nas klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho la bsnun par bya'o //
translated: Having recited the mantra over white mustard seeds one thousand and eight times, one should strike the ocean nāga king with them.

original: stong rtsa brgyad rdzogs pa dang / char gyi rgyun chen po 'bab par byed do //
analyzed: stong rtsa brgyad rdzogs pa dang / char gyi rgyun chen po 'bab par byed do //
translated: When one has completed one thousand and eight [recitations], he will cause a great rain to fall.

original: gal te lo stong du char mi 'bab par 'gyur ba las 'phral nyid du lhas char 'bebs par byed pa the tshom med do //
analyzed: gal te lo stong du char mi 'bab par 'gyur ba las 'phral nyid du lhas char 'bebs par byed pa the tshom med do //
translated: If it has not rained for a thousand years, the gods will immediately cause rain to fall—there is no doubt.

original: rlung dang / sad dang / ser ba'i dus su de'i ras ris khang ba'i steng du bzhag ste /
analyzed: rlung dang / sad dang / ser ba'i dus su de'i ras ris khang ba'i steng du bzhag ste /
translated: During times of wind, hail, and frost, one should place that painting on the roof of a house.

original: rlung dang / sad dang / ser ba thams cad phyir zhing mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rlung dang / sad dang / ser ba thams cad phyir zhing mi 'byung ngo //
translated: All wind, hail, and frost will not occur again.

original: phyogs gang du ras ris rnam par lta bar byed pa de'i phyogs kyi gnas su rlung dang / sad dang / ser ba mi 'bab ste /
analyzed: phyogs gang du ras ris rnam par lta bar byed pa de'i phyogs kyi gnas su rlung dang / sad dang / ser ba mi 'bab ste /
translated: In whatever direction the painting is looked at, in that direction the wind, hail, and rain will not fall.

original: ri'am dgon dung 'khrigs par yang mi 'bab bo //
analyzed: ri'am dgon dung 'khrigs par yang mi 'bab bo //
translated: It will not fall on a mountain or in a ravine.

original: yang na rig sngags 'chang gis ras ris de bzung nas klu'i gnas kyi mtshor song nas gnas kyi mtsho der gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rig sngags 'chang gis ras ris de bzung nas klu'i gnas kyi mtshor song nas gnas kyi mtsho der gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Or the knowledge-holder should take the painting and go to a lake in the nāga realm and place it there.

original: don yod zhags pa'i mchod pa'i nor bu'i snying po'i gzungs stong rtsa brgyad du chu la bzlas te gnas pa'i mtsho ru 'phang bar bya'o //
analyzed: don yod zhags pa'i mchod pa'i nor bu'i snying po'i gzungs stong rtsa brgyad du chu la bzlas te gnas pa'i mtsho ru 'phang bar bya'o //
translated: He should recite the dhāraṇī of the jewel essence of Amoghapāśa’s offering eight thousand times over water and sprinkle the lake.

original: 'phags pa tsam gyi mod la gnas der gnas pa'i klu khye'u'i gzugs kyis lus phyed gnas de nas thon te ras ris de la phyag 'tshal bar byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa tsam gyi mod la gnas der gnas pa'i klu khye'u'i gzugs kyis lus phyed gnas de nas thon te ras ris de la phyag 'tshal bar byed do //
translated: The moment it is sprinkled, the nāga living there will emerge from the water in the form of a youth and pay homage to the painting.

original: rig sngags 'chang ba la smras pa /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang ba la smras pa /
translated: He will say to the knowledge-holder,

original: rig sngags 'chang gi bka' bsgo ba ci yin pa bdag gis bgyi'o zhes so //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gi bka' bsgo ba ci yin pa bdag gis bgyi'o zhes so //
translated: ‘What command of the knowledge-holder shall I carry out?’”

original: rig sngags 'chang gis smra @323b bar bya ste /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gis smra @323b bar bya ste /
translated: The vidyādhara should speak:

original: klu chen po /
analyzed: klu chen po /
translated: “Great nāga!

original: 'dzam bu'i gling kun tu lta bar gyis shig /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling kun tu lta bar gyis shig /
translated: Look out over the entire world!🔽”

original: khye'u de yang phyogs bzhi kun tu rnam par lta bar byed do //
analyzed: khye'u de yang phyogs bzhi kun tu rnam par lta bar byed do //
translated: The child will look in all four directions.

original: ji lta ji ltar mtshan ma mthong ba de lta de ltar rig sngags 'chad la mtshan ma smra bar 'gyur te /🔽legs par byas pa'am /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar mtshan ma mthong ba de lta de ltar rig sngags 'chad la mtshan ma smra bar 'gyur te / legs par byas pa'am /
translated: Whatever signs he sees, the vidyādhara should describe them and speak the signs.

original: nyes par byas pa de thams cad smra bar byed do //
analyzed: nyes par byas pa de thams cad smra bar byed do //
translated: Whether they are good or bad, he should describe them all.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis brjod par bya ste /
translated: Then the vidyādhara should say:

original: klu chen po /
analyzed: klu chen po /
translated: “Great nāga!

original: char phob la tshim par gyis shig /
analyzed: char phob la tshim par gyis shig /
translated: Send down rain and satisfy!

original: dzam bu gling pa'i rtsva dang nags kyi bdag po dang / ri dang / tshang tshing dang / dgon pa dang / zhing dang / kun dga' ra ba rnams thams cad du char gyi rgyun 'byin par gyis shig /
analyzed: dzam bu gling pa'i rtsva dang nags kyi bdag po dang / ri dang / tshang tshing dang / dgon pa dang / zhing dang / kun dga' ra ba rnams thams cad du char gyi rgyun 'byin par gyis shig /
translated: Send down a rain shower everywhere in the world, over the grass, the lords of the forest, the mountains, the thickets, the wilderness, the fields, and the parks.

original: lha'i chus kun nas char phob cig /
analyzed: lha'i chus kun nas char phob cig /
translated: Send down rain with divine water!

original: sems can thams cad kyi lha'i chu'i char gyi rgyun chen po phob cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi lha'i chu'i char gyi rgyun chen po phob cig /
translated: Let there be a great rain of divine water for all sentient beings!”

original: klu'i khye'u la smras pa /
analyzed: klu'i khye'u la smras pa /
translated: To the nāga boy, he should say:

original: kye bcud len mchog tu gya nom pa'i rig sngags kyi gzhi byin cig ces rig sngags 'chang gis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kye bcud len mchog tu gya nom pa'i rig sngags kyi gzhi byin cig ces rig sngags 'chang gis brjod par bya'o //
translated: “Oh! Give the basis of the supreme and excellent elixir of life!”

original: klu'i khye'u / bdud rtsi bcud kyi len gyi mchog zungs shig ces so; ;de nas klu'i khye'u de rig sngags 'chang la mngon du phyogs te thal mo sbyar nas nye bar 'dug go /
analyzed: klu'i khye'u / bdud rtsi bcud kyi len gyi mchog zungs shig ces so; ;de nas klu'i khye'u de rig sngags 'chang la mngon du phyogs te thal mo sbyar nas nye bar 'dug go /
translated: The nāga boy should then face the knowledge-vidyādhara, join his palms, and sit down.🔽The knowledge-vidyādhara should say to the great nāga:

original: rig sngags 'chang gis klu chen po nyon cig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gis klu chen po nyon cig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: “Listen!”

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan par bya //🔽'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / 'phags @324a *//
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan par bya // 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / 'phags @324a *//
translated: Then the knowledge-vidyādhara should teach dependent origination,

original: pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: the four noble truths, the eighteen unique qualities of the Buddha, and the eightfold noble path.

original: don yod zhags pa'i mdo yang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: don yod zhags pa'i mdo yang bstan par bya'o //
translated: I will also teach the Amoghapāśa Sūtra.

original: gang gi tshe rig sngags 'chang de lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston bzhin pa na klu'i lus las bdug pa 'khrigs pa'i sprin chen po nges par thon te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rig sngags 'chang de lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston bzhin pa na klu'i lus las bdug pa 'khrigs pa'i sprin chen po nges par thon te /
translated: When the vidyādhara is teaching the Dharma of the Tathāgata in this way, a great cloud of incense smoke will definitely emerge from the nāga’s body

original: nam mkha'i dkyil du g-yogs par byed cing gnas so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil du g-yogs par byed cing gnas so //
translated: and cover the realm of space.

original: chos ston pa'i skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la char gyi rgyun chen po 'bebs par byed de /
analyzed: chos ston pa'i skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la char gyi rgyun chen po 'bebs par byed de /
translated: In that very instant, in that very moment, a great rain will fall,

original: sa'i mtsho der char pa 'bab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sa'i mtsho der char pa 'bab pa ma yin no //
translated: but it will not fall into the ocean of the earth.

original: rig sngags 'chang dang / ras ris kyi steng du klu'i khye'u de ras ris de la mchod pa byed do //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang dang / ras ris kyi steng du klu'i khye'u de ras ris de la mchod pa byed do //
translated: The nāga boy will make offerings to the painting above the vidyādhara.

original: rig sngags 'chang de la yon dang bcas pas chos la mchod pa 'bul bar byed de /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang de la yon dang bcas pas chos la mchod pa 'bul bar byed de /
translated: He will make offerings to the Dharma together with gifts for the vidyādhara.

original: rig sngags 'chang gis smras pa /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gis smras pa /
translated: The vidyādhara will say:

original: rig sngags 'chang gi sar khyod zhugs shig /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gi sar khyod zhugs shig /
translated: ‘You have entered the stage of the vidyādhara.

original: de rnams 'di skad ces rig sngags 'chang rang gi khyim gyis chog go /
analyzed: de rnams 'di skad ces rig sngags 'chang rang gi khyim gyis chog go /
translated: The spirits will say, It is enough that the master of awareness has his own home.

original: rig sngags 'chang gis smra bar bya ste; gal te dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'khor dang bcas pa yang dag par len par byed na /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gis smra bar bya ste; gal te dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'khor dang bcas pa yang dag par len par byed na /
translated: The master of awareness should say, If you take up the path of the ten virtuous actions together with their prerequisites,

original: de'i tshe nga khyod kyi gnas mchog tu 'jug par bya'o //🔽gal te mi byed na /
analyzed: de'i tshe nga khyod kyi gnas mchog tu 'jug par bya'o // gal te mi byed na /
translated: then I will let you enter my supreme abode.

original: 'jug par mi bya'o zhes so //🔽de nas khye'u de gal te byed na /
analyzed: 'jug par mi bya'o zhes so // de nas khye'u de gal te byed na /
translated: If you do not, I will not let you in.🔽Then, if the boy does take up the path of the ten virtuous actions,

original: dge ba ston pa mthong ba de'i tshe rang gi gzugs kyis gnas par byed de /
analyzed: dge ba ston pa mthong ba de'i tshe rang gi gzugs kyis gnas par byed de /
translated: at that time the master of awareness will show himself in his own form,

original: lha rdzas kyi rna rgyan dri ma med pa g-yo ba /
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi rna rgyan dri ma med pa g-yo ba /
translated: wearing a divine, stainless, moving earring,

original: @324b skra'i cod pan 'chang ba /
analyzed: @324b skra'i cod pan 'chang ba /
translated: a diadem of hair,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa'o //
translated: and adorned with all ornaments.

original: gal te mi byed na /🔽khye'u de'i gzugs mi snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mi byed na / khye'u de'i gzugs mi snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the boy does not take up the path of the ten virtuous actions,

original: slar yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: slar yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: the master of awareness will disappear and will not be seen again.

original: yang na rdzu 'phrul chen po can gyi klu'i rgyal po mthong bar 'dod pa'i rig sngags 'chang des zangs kyi 'dab ma la don yod pa'i mchod pa'i nor bu'i snying po'i gzungs de'i steng du bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rdzu 'phrul chen po can gyi klu'i rgyal po mthong bar 'dod pa'i rig sngags 'chang des zangs kyi 'dab ma la don yod pa'i mchod pa'i nor bu'i snying po'i gzungs de'i steng du bri bar bya ste /
translated: “Or, the practitioner who wishes to see the great nāga king should write the uṣṇīṣa cakravartin on a copper plate with lac dye and place the Dhāraṇī of the Essence of the Wish-Fulfilling Jewel on top of it.

original: sbrang rtsis byug par bya'o //
analyzed: sbrang rtsis byug par bya'o //
translated: He should anoint it with honey.

original: yungs kar la lan brgya rtsa brgyad du yongs su bzlas te gtor bar bya ste /
analyzed: yungs kar la lan brgya rtsa brgyad du yongs su bzlas te gtor bar bya ste /
translated: He should scatter white mustard seeds over it one hundred and eight times.

original: gnas pa'i mtsho der 'phang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtsho der 'phang bar bya'o //
translated: He should cast it into the lake where the nāga resides.

original: gu gul zho gcig tshad kyis mchod nas bdug pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gu gul zho gcig tshad kyis mchod nas bdug pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: He should offer a measure of guggul incense and give off the smoke.

original: ji srid du gu gul phyed kyi cha shas kyi lhag ma las kyi bar du bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du gu gul phyed kyi cha shas kyi lhag ma las kyi bar du bsreg par bya'o //
translated: He should burn it until half of the guggul is left.

original: skad cig yud tsam thang gcig de la klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho bram ze'i gzugs kyis klu'i mtshor nye bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: skad cig yud tsam thang gcig de la klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho bram ze'i gzugs kyis klu'i mtshor nye bar 'dug ste /
translated: At that very moment, in an instant, in a flash, the nāga king Sāgara will appear in the form of a brahman in the nāga lake.

original: rig sngags 'chang la shis brjod par byed do //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang la shis brjod par byed do //
translated: He will pronounce auspicious words to the practitioner.

original: rig sngags 'chang gis kyang nad med par gyur cig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gis kyang nad med par gyur cig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The vidyādhara should say, “May you be free from illness.”

original: kye chos kyi don gyi tshig nyon cig /
analyzed: kye chos kyi don gyi tshig nyon cig /
translated: “Listen, O Dharma, to the meaning of the words!

original: chos dang 'jig rten mang po yang skyongs shig ces so //
analyzed: chos dang 'jig rten mang po yang skyongs shig ces so //
translated: Uphold the many dharmas and worldly [matters]!”

original: bram ze de yang dga' ste rig sngags 'chang ci 'dod pa'i don gang yin pa'i don de smros shig dang / thams cad smra bar 'gyur ro //

translated: He will become like those who have seen the dhāraṇī of the essence of the offering of the Amogha-jewel.

original: bklags @334a *// pa dang / brjod pa tsam gyi mod la dus gsum du gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kyi sras gcig pur 'gyur ro //

translated: As soon as he has read and recited it, he will become the only son of all the Tathāgatas who have gone in the three times.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i sku shin tu dri ma med cing yongs su dag pa dang mnyam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i sku shin tu dri ma med cing yongs su dag pa dang mnyam par 'gyur te /
translated: He will become equal to the completely pure body of all the Tathāgatas, completely stainless and pure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i skur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i skur yang 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dus gsum pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis phyir mi ldog par lung ston cing /
translated: All the Tathāgatas of the three times will prophesy his irreversibility.

original: bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will receive the prophecy of unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par mthong bar 'gyur ro //

original: lha thams cad kyis yang dag par dbugs 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha thams cad kyis yang dag par dbugs 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: All gods will comfort them.

original: bdud la sogs pa dang / gdug pa'i rmi lam dang / log par 'dren pa thams cad tshar bcad par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud la sogs pa dang / gdug pa'i rmi lam dang / log par 'dren pa thams cad tshar bcad par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will destroy all demons and evil dreams and all that leads astray.

original: bcing pa lngas bcings shing gzir ba dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / sha za dang / yi dvags dang / grul bum dang / brjed byed dang / tshangs pa srin po rnams thams cad ring du 'bros par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcing pa lngas bcings shing gzir ba dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / sha za dang / yi dvags dang / grul bum dang / brjed byed dang / tshangs pa srin po rnams thams cad ring du 'bros par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be freed from the five fetters and will be oppressed by no one. Yakṣas, rākṣasas, bhūtas, piśācas, pretas, pūtanas, and kaṭapūtanas will all flee far away.

original: rims thams cad dang / nad thams cad dang / 'bras dang / phol mig dang / rtsog shu dang / lhog pa dang / mtshan par rdol pa dang / g-yan pa dang / mdze dang / rkang shu thams cad rnam par nyams pa byed do //
analyzed: rims thams cad dang / nad thams cad dang / 'bras dang / phol mig dang / rtsog shu dang / lhog pa dang / mtshan par rdol pa dang / g-yan pa dang / mdze dang / rkang shu thams cad rnam par nyams pa byed do //
translated: all fevers, all diseases, boils, pustules, smallpox, epilepsy, dysentery, leprosy, and all skin diseases will be destroyed.

original: lus kyi gzer thams cad @334b nye bar zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi gzer thams cad @334b nye bar zhi bar byed do //
translated: All pains in the body will be pacified.

original: ji ltar shel yongs su dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar shel yongs su dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The body of the Tathāgata will be purified, just like a pure crystal.

original: tshig btsan par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig btsan par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One will have powerful speech.

original: gsang sngags dang / cho ga zhib mo thams cad kyi dngos grub tu yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsang sngags dang / cho ga zhib mo thams cad kyi dngos grub tu yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One will attain the siddhi of all mantras and vidyās.

original: 'jig rten thams cad dga' bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dga' bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be loved by all people.

original: rgyal po dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / khyim bag gis cher mchod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / khyim bag gis cher mchod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be worshipped by kings, brahmins, kṣatriyas, and householders.

original: sems can thams cad kyi mchod par 'os pa gcig pur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mchod par 'os pa gcig pur 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become worthy of offerings from all beings.

original: nor dang 'bru 'phel bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru 'phel bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: their wealth and grain will increase.

original: bsam pa dang / yid kyi shing rta thams cad yongs su rdzogs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa dang / yid kyi shing rta thams cad yongs su rdzogs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: All their wishes and mental aspirations will be fulfilled.

original: chom rkun dang / g-yo can dang / rkun pos rnam par skrag pa dang / gcan gzan khro bo dang / g-yangs dang / khyim rdib pa dang / gsod pa dang 'tshe ba dang / gcan gzan khro bo'i 'jigs pa rnams thams cad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chom rkun dang / g-yo can dang / rkun pos rnam par skrag pa dang / gcan gzan khro bo dang / g-yangs dang / khyim rdib pa dang / gsod pa dang 'tshe ba dang / gcan gzan khro bo'i 'jigs pa rnams thams cad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be frightened by thieves, swindlers, or robbers, nor by ferocious beasts, nor by the collapse of a building, nor by murder, violence, or the fear of ferocious beasts.

original: me dang chus dus byed pa dang / rlung dang / tshad pa dang / sad dang / ser ba rnams kyis mi tshugs so //
analyzed: me dang chus dus byed pa dang / rlung dang / tshad pa dang / sad dang / ser ba rnams kyis mi tshugs so //
translated: They will not be harmed by fire, water, wind, heat waves, hail, or frost.

original: dgra thams cad kyis 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra thams cad kyis 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be afraid of any enemies.

original: thams cad byams pa'i yid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad byams pa'i yid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Everyone will be friendly.

original: bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khye'u dang / bu mo thams cad dbang du gyur par byed do //
analyzed: bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khye'u dang / bu mo thams cad dbang du gyur par byed do //
translated: They will bring under their control all women, men, boys, and girls.

original: 'di ni / bklags pa tsam gyis 'jig rten pa rnams kyi yon tan chen po bskyed pa dang / rnam par 'phrul par 'gyur ro //🔽de 'chi 'pho ba'i dus kyi tshe de bzhin gshegs @335a *//
analyzed: 'di ni / bklags pa tsam gyis 'jig rten pa rnams kyi yon tan chen po bskyed pa dang / rnam par 'phrul par 'gyur ro // de 'chi 'pho ba'i dus kyi tshe de bzhin gshegs @335a *//
translated: By merely reading it, worldly people will generate great qualities and will become emanations.

original: pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa gnyis mngon sum du mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa gnyis mngon sum du mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: At the time of their death, they will directly perceive 9,200,000,000,000 tathāgatas.

original: rigs kyi bu chur shog /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chur shog /
translated: ‘Son of noble family, come here!

original: bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su song dang / khyod kyis lam yongs su dag par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su song dang / khyod kyis lam yongs su dag par byas pa'o //
translated: Go to the world system of Sukhāvatī, and you will have purified the path.

original: 'chi ba'i dus su gyur pa na bsam pa nyid kyi mod la padmo las brdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su gyur pa na bsam pa nyid kyi mod la padmo las brdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of death, as soon as you think of it, you will be born miraculously from a lotus.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa dang / tshe rabs dran par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa dang / tshe rabs dran par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: You will be adorned with all ornaments and will remember your former lives.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med mngon sum du mthong ba tsam gyis phyir mi ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med mngon sum du mthong ba tsam gyis phyir mi ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: By merely directly perceiving the tathāgata Amitābha, you will become irreversible.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: and he will receive a prophecy of his unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / padmo yangs pa'i gsang ba mtha' dag rdzogs pa dang / don yod zhags pa'i snying po 'i cho ga zhib mo mngon du 'gyur zhing kha ton du kun tu gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / padmo yangs pa'i gsang ba mtha' dag rdzogs pa dang / don yod zhags pa'i snying po 'i cho ga zhib mo mngon du 'gyur zhing kha ton du kun tu gnas so //
translated: The entire mandala of liberation, the secret of the vast lotus, will be accomplished, and the essence of the Amoghapaśa will manifest and be recited.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor rjes su dran par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor rjes su dran par byed do //
translated: He will recall the entire mandala of the secret of all the tathāgatas.

original: thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi zhing kun tu de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis mngon sum du mtshungs par lhan cig lung ston pa so sor thob ste /
analyzed: thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi zhing kun tu de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis mngon sum du mtshungs par lhan cig lung ston pa so sor thob ste /
translated: Everywhere, in all the buddha-fields, he will receive the prophecy of all the tathāgatas, face to face, simultaneously.

original: nam du yang phyir zhing rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang / ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu bstan pa'i bar dang / ji srid du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i lus su gyur gyi bar du 'jig rten @335b las 'das pa'i phan yon dang /
analyzed: nam du yang phyir zhing rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang / ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu bstan pa'i bar dang / ji srid du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i lus su gyur gyi bar du 'jig rten @335b las 'das pa'i phan yon dang /
translated: One will also obtain the supramundane benefits and emanations, as taught in the Buddha’s enlightenment, up to the attainment of the body of complete nirvāṇa.

original: rnam par 'phrul pa bklags pas grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'phrul pa bklags pas grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will accomplish the recitation by merely reading it.

original: de nas bzlas pa tsam gyis dngos grub bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bzlas pa tsam gyis dngos grub bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the accomplishment by mere recitation will be explained.

original: snga dro gcig bzlas pa tsam gyi mod la mtshams med pa lnga'i sdig pa dang / mnan ri med pa'i mthar gtugs pa'i sdig pa dang / ri rab lhun po chen po bdun gyi tshad tsam ba sbu'i khor bu rer sgrib pa bsags pa dang /
analyzed: snga dro gcig bzlas pa tsam gyi mod la mtshams med pa lnga'i sdig pa dang / mnan ri med pa'i mthar gtugs pa'i sdig pa dang / ri rab lhun po chen po bdun gyi tshad tsam ba sbu'i khor bu rer sgrib pa bsags pa dang /
translated: By merely reciting once in the morning, the five sins of immediate retribution, the sins that lead to the end of the eon, and the obscurations accumulated in each pore of the body, which are as large as the seven great Sumeru mountains,

original: bskal pa stong phrag tu bsags pa'i sngon gyi sdig pa dang sgrib pa de rnams thams cad snga dro gcig bzlas pa tsam gyis sdig pa dang las kyi sgrib pa rnam par nyams par byed de /
analyzed: bskal pa stong phrag tu bsags pa'i sngon gyi sdig pa dang sgrib pa de rnams thams cad snga dro gcig bzlas pa tsam gyis sdig pa dang las kyi sgrib pa rnam par nyams par byed de /
translated: All those former misdeeds and obscurations accumulated over thousands of eons, by merely reciting [the mantra] for one morning, will cause the obscurations of misdeeds and karma to be completely destroyed.

original: zad pa dang / yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zad pa dang / yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be exhausted and completely purified.

original: dmyal ba'i 'gro ba chen po bcu drug tu gzhol ba de rnams thams cad skad cig gcig gis yongs su grol lo //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i 'gro ba chen po bcu drug tu gzhol ba de rnams thams cad skad cig gcig gis yongs su grol lo //
translated: All those who are headed for the sixteen great destinies of the hells will be completely liberated in an instant.

original: smyung par gnas pa gcig gis bzlas pa dus gsum pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su kun tu bzang po chen po nyid thob bo //
analyzed: smyung par gnas pa gcig gis bzlas pa dus gsum pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su kun tu bzang po chen po nyid thob bo //
translated: Through a single day's fasting and recitation, one will attain the state of Great Samantabhadra in the buddha realms of the Tathagatas of the three times.

original: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang / padmo yangs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / don yod zhags pa'i snying po thams cad du dngos su rjes su 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang / padmo yangs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / don yod zhags pa'i snying po thams cad du dngos su rjes su 'jug par byed do //
translated: One will also actually engage in all the Tathagata families, the mandala of the liberation of the vast lotus, and the essence of the Amoghapasha.

original: thams cad du dam tshig chen po yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad du dam tshig chen po yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In all circumstances, one will uphold the great commitments.

original: 'phags pa sbyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rang gi gzugs kyis dngos su mthong ba sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa sbyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rang gi gzugs kyis dngos su mthong ba sbyin par byed do //
translated: One will be granted the vision of the noble Avalokiteśvara in his own form.

original: dus gsum pa'i de bzhin @336a *//
analyzed: dus gsum pa'i de bzhin @336a *//
translated: The tathāgatas of the three times

original: gshegs pa rnams rang gi gzugs kyis dngos su mthong bar nye bar gnas par byed do //

original: ras ris rnams gsungs pa /

analyzed: sa dang ba byung gis legs par byugs shing shin tu 'jam pa la tshon sna tshogs pas bkra ba'i srad bus char gzhal cing bcad la dkyil 'khor bla na med pa'i dbus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi snying por bdag gi khrus tshad kyis kun nas khru bzhi pa sgo
translated: Having well anointed it with cow dung, and having made it very smooth, having sprinkled it with water and having divided it with cords of various colors, in the center of the unexcelled mandala, in the heart of the mandala, one should make a square basin for the bathing water, with a measure of one's own cubit,

original: bzhi rnam par phye ba bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi rnam par phye ba bya'o //

analyzed: thams cad du gsang ba thun mong pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / dbus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi snying por yang padma bya ste /

analyzed: padma stong phrag gis shin tu mdzes pa lnga lnga'o //

analyzed: padma dkar po bla na med pa la ze 'bru dang / ge sar gyi tshad la bab pa /

analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i ge sar dang / ze 'bru bkra ba'i dra ba'i snying po lus dang lag tu 'chang zhing /

analyzed: lag pa'i phyag rgya g-yon pa dang / g-yas pas bya'o //

original: dar dpyangs dang 'khyil bas spa ba /
analyzed: dar dpyangs dang 'khyil bas spa ba /

analyzed: zur zur du dpag bsam gyi shing shin tu tshad la bab pa cho ga ji lta ba bzhin @345a *//

analyzed: du byed du gzhug go /

analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa bya zhing /

original: de nas me tog gi bar du re kha bya'o //
analyzed: de nas me tog gi bar du re kha bya'o //

original: rgyan sna tshogs kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs kyis rnam par brgyan pa /

original: gos sna tshogs pa mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: gos sna tshogs pa mdzes pa'o //

analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rgyan gyi phyi rol tu padma dang / autpal sngon po'i phreng ba'i ri mo'o //
translated: Outside the various ornaments, there is a design of a garland of lotuses and blue lotuses.

analyzed: autpal sngon po'i phyi rol tu nor bu rin po cha sna tshogs pas rnam par bkra ba'i ri mo 'bar ba'i phreng bas mdzes pa'o //

analyzed: me tog sna ma dang tsam pa ka'i phreng ba dag la sngags kyi nor bu'i ri mo yang bya'o //

analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi khor yug tu snam bu'i rnam pa bya'o //

analyzed: khor yug tu chu 'bab pa'i snying po'i dkyil 'khor 'di 'bri zhing /

analyzed: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyi khor yug tu gang bri bar bya ste /

analyzed: rin po che'i lcug ma sna tshogs pa dang / bum pa gang ba thogs par bya'o //

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi snying por ba ngan gyis brgyan par bya'o //

analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i bdug pas bdugs la bdug pa'i spog phor yongs su bsham par bya'o //

analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgo bar bya /

analyzed: legs par khrus byas shing dri bzang po'i dris bskos te /

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bdug pas bdugs la /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bdug pas bdugs la /

original: ba byung lngas nye reg bya ste /
analyzed: ba byung lngas nye reg bya ste /

analyzed: don yod pa nor bu'i mchod pa'i snying po'i gzungs 'di lan stong rtsa rgyad du bzlas par bya'o //

analyzed: dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rdul phra rab kyi grangs dang mnyam pa yid la bya'o //

analyzed: mchod pa'i sprin chen po yid la bya zhing bzla ste /

original: phyogs bcu kun nas sangs rgyas kyi @346a *//
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun nas sangs rgyas kyi @346a *//
translated: From all the ten directions, the buddhas

translated: The bhagavat buddhas who are included in all realms are the tathagatas of the three times who have gone to each buddha realm.🔽With the clouds of offerings to the tathagatas, they are gathered in the mandala as various incalculable accumulations.🔽Each tathagata is gathered in a great, incalculable mandala of hundreds of thousands.

analyzed: pa sna tshogs su gzhal du med pas ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su bsags pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa re re yang dkyil 'khor chen po gzhal du med pa brgya stong phrag yongs su bsags pas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar mchod pa'i sprin chen po byed

translated: They make great clouds of offerings to each of the tathāgatas together with their retinues of bodhisattvas, with various kinds of clothing, various kinds of ornaments and jewelry, divine flowers, various kinds of divine fragrances, various kinds of divine incense, divine fruits,

original: me tog sna tshogs pa dang / ro brgya pa'i kha zas kyi mchog ro bro ba'i mchog rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / sgron ma'i shing sna tshogs pa brgya stong phrag rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa la mchod pa'i sprin chen po byed do //
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs pa dang / ro brgya pa'i kha zas kyi mchog ro bro ba'i mchog rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / sgron ma'i shing sna tshogs pa brgya stong phrag rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa la mchod pa'i sprin chen po byed do //
translated: various kinds of divine food with a hundred flavors, the best of delicacies, and various kinds of lamps, hundreds of thousands of them.

analyzed: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i lha rdzas kyi rol mo'i sgra rnams kyis mchod pa'i sprin byed do //
translated: They make clouds of offerings with the sounds of divine music with five aspects.

original: de lta bu'i cho ga rnams phyogs bcu rnams su sangs rgyas kyi zhing re re'i de bzhin gshegs pa re @346b re'i mchod pa'i sprin chen pos dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rdul phra rab kyi grangs rnams mchod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i cho ga rnams phyogs bcu rnams su sangs rgyas kyi zhing re re'i de bzhin gshegs pa re @346b re'i mchod pa'i sprin chen pos dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rdul phra rab kyi grangs rnams mchod par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, in each of the buddha fields in the ten directions, with great clouds of offerings to each of the thus-gone ones, you will make offerings to the thus-gone ones of the three times, as numerous as the atoms in every world.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad du lhun grub tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad du lhun grub tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This will occur spontaneously in all the maṇḍalas of the retinue.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po gzhal du med pa'i mchod pa'i sprin gyis mchod par byed do //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po gzhal du med pa'i mchod pa'i sprin gyis mchod par byed do //
translated: You will make offerings with great clouds of offerings to the immeasurable maṇḍala.

original: gang yang dkyil 'khor chen po der rjes su zhugs pa'i sems can dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje rigs dang / dmangs rigs dang / bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khye'u dang / bu mo gang yin pa de rnams thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang dkyil 'khor chen po der rjes su zhugs pa'i sems can dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje rigs dang / dmangs rigs dang / bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khye'u dang / bu mo gang yin pa de rnams thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the beings who enter that great maṇḍala—whether they are mendicants, brahmins, kṣatriyas, vaiśyas, śūdras, women, men, boys, or girls—will complete the six perfections.

original: de la mthong bar 'dod pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / lhan cig 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: de la mthong bar 'dod pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / lhan cig 'gro ba'am /
translated: Whoever wishes to see it, rejoices in it, or goes along with it,

original: tha na thos pa tsam gang yin pa de thams cad phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na thos pa tsam gang yin pa de thams cad phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: even if it is just hearing about it, will all become irreversible and will complete the six perfections.

original: sbyin pa chen po yongs su gtong ba yongs su gtong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po yongs su gtong ba yongs su gtong bar 'gyur /
translated: They will give the great gifts and make offerings.

original: bsod nams kyi phung po dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi phung po dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will generate the mass of merit and the roots of virtue.

original: sems can re re'i yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu dang mnyam pa de'i drung du dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bsod nams kyi phung po bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can re re'i yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu dang mnyam pa de'i drung du dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bsod nams kyi phung po bskyed par 'gyur ro //
